text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies
Ro: Today I have a special guest, CaptainSparklez!
CS: Hi there!

Ro: He has an awesome gaming channel, I’ll
put a link down below so you can go

Ro: check it out, and I thought Jordan would
be the perfect guest today because you
Ro: play a lot of Minecraft. CS: That I do.

Ro: And today, we are gonna be making a Minecraft
Pumpkin Pie!
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 1 can
of pure pumpkin, 1 can of evaporated

Ro: milk, 2 eggs, 1/2 a teaspoon of salt,
1/2 a teaspoon of ginger, 1 teaspoon of

Ro: cinnamon, and, I’ve got some instant
pillsbury pie crusts but if you’d like

Ro: to make some from scratch, feel free!
You will also need…

CS: 3/4 cup of sugar, a pie plate, a big mixing
bowl, a hand mixer and a big knife!
Ro: Yep, let’s put it all together!
CS: Ye-ah!
CS: So, what do we do first?

Ro: 1st thing that we’re gonna do is make
our pumpkin pie filling, so I’m gonna

Ro: have you open up our pure pumpkin, here
we go. CS: Oh boy…

Ro: I’m gonna put you to work, here I’ll
get this out of the way. CS: Do I, do I?

CS: Does this come with an instruction manual
or anything?

Ro: Um, I think you, I know you open it and
you kind of, like, connect the 2,

Ro: sharp sides… CS: So dis… disclaimer
for everyone, I haven’t cooked anything

CS: in like 15 years… That’s the way.
Ro: You hold it and, and, and I… I’ll twist it.
Ro: Oh this way. CS: Oh, OK, oh! Here we go! Wait, no it’s not clamped anymore! Ro: Oh what did I do?

Ro: Jordan, welcome to my show, I’m such
a pro!
CS: There we go. Ro: Oh, OH pfft! CS: Almost!
Ro: Um, can you get the lid out of there?

CS: I broke it! Ro: Oh you did it! CS: I know,
but I broke the spatula!

Ro: It’s OK, we’ve got plenty of spatulas
in this house. CS: OK.

Ro: Can you fling it off? Just fling it! Just
go for it!

CS: It’s kind of, it’s still, like, sort
of attached, so…
CS: It’s gonna be like a ninja star!
Ro: Oh my gosh, oh my gosh!

CS: That was easy… Ro: Mmmhmm, and just…
CS: Let’s scoop it into here.

Ro: Now you’re gonna mix in your sugar,
Jordan grab the sugar. CS: OK.

Ro: And I’m gonna toss in the cinnamon,
just pour it all in.
CS: I don’t get to like… Eat this?

Ro: Ah, no, no! We need it in the pie! We
need it in the pie!

Ro: Now we’re gonna add the ginger and the
salt. Cheers, ding!

Ro: Have you ever done a 1 handed egg crack?
CS: … Maybe?

Ro: OK, we’re gonna attempt it. CS: OK.
Ro: And it’s just crack, twist,

Ro: kinda with your hand, and if it, if it’s not
perfect, that’s fine, doesn’t matter,

Ro: we’re learning. CS: OK. Ro: OK, you
ready? CS: I mean, I’ll try…
Ro: So you go crack, twist! CS: Oh boy. Ro: And then just throw your shells in

Ro: here, I’ll be ready. CS: That was intimidating,
ah… Ro: You got it, you got it!

Ro: I spilled look over here. CS: Ta-ha-ha-ha!
Ro: Nice, nice get it in there, great!
CS: Oh here we go! Did I do it?

Ro: Yeah, it was pretty good. CS: OK. Ro:
Now we’re gonna go wash our hands!

CS: Alright, so now that we’ve opened up our
cans in a really, really professional

CS: fashion, and added everything into here,
we wanna mix it!

Ro: Yep, alright so grab the hand mixer, and
we’re gonna mix everything together on

Ro: a low speed, if you put it on a high speed
it will fly everywhere,

Ro: so I’m gonna show you. CS: So, put it
on like, 5, right? Ro: Yeah, no…

Ro: Don’t put it on 5, just put it on 1.
CS: OK. Ro: There you go.

CS: OK. Ro: And just mix together until it’s
well combined. CS: Oh that’s fancy!
Ro: Take about a minute.

CS: Now we get to open another can again.
Ro: Mmmhmm.

CS: Which is good because we’re professionals
and the last one, like, it went
CS: really smoothly. Ro: Went really well!

CS: Here we go, this is liquid, so higher
stakes…
CS: Alright, and spin it around.

Ro: So Jordan’s gonna slowly pour in the
milk and I’m gonna mix
Ro: until it’s all mixed together.
CS: Alright. Ro: OK, so you start slowly pouring.
Ro: Ready? And I’ll mix it in there.

CS: OK, so now we’re gonna set this off
to the side and

CS: we’ll go and get our pie crust ready.
Ro: Om-nom-nom-nom-nom!

Ro: We do have 2 pie crusts, but we’re just
gonna be using 1 at first.

Ro: So I’m gonna have you open it up with
the scissors, just cut an end. CS: Alright.

Ro: You can do it! CS: Hopefully, hopefully
I’ll be, uh, just as good at this
CS: as I am with cans.

Ro: Now we’re just gonna unroll it and lay
it in the center of the pan.

Ro: Just be a little gentle. CS: OK. Ro: And
then really gently unroll, are you ready?

CS: I’m ready. Ro: Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
CS: Oh boy!

Ro: Press down in the corners with your hand.
CS: OK, so we want to, like, fit it

CS: perfectly to the… Ro: Yeah. CS: To the
bowl.

Ro: Now you’re just gonna slowly pour your
pie mixture into your pan.

Ro: So just… You can do it! I’m gonna…
Are you ready? CS: You look so nervous!

Ro: You can do it, you can do it! CS: Alright,
there we… there we go!

Ro: Nice! that is a steady pour, that is a
great pour! CS: Thank you.

CS: Alright, so now you’re gonna heat your
oven to 425 degrees and
CS: bake it for 15 minutes . Ro: And then you’re gonna reduce the heat to 350 and

Ro: bake the pie for an additional 40 minutes,
it is a double bake process.

CS: And that’s… Because science. Ro: Because
of science! CS: Yeah. Ro: And… Magic!

Ro: Now the pie is in the oven, we are gonna
decorate and make a

Ro: pixelated pie crust decoration. So we’re
gonna have to open 1 of these again.

CS: Oh boy! My specialty! Ro: I’m gonna
hand it over, hee-hee!

CS: I like how I just open all the things.
Ro: Hahaha yup!

Ro: Now you’re just gonna roll it out on
top of this.

Ro: I just got a baking sheet with 1 piece
of parchment paper, so that it won’t stick.

Ro: I cut out an 8 inch circle, and we’re
just gonna use that as a template.

Ro: So we’re gonna stick it right on top
of the dough, and you’re gonna take a

Ro: sharp cutting knife. CS: Oh my goodness!
Ro: You can do it, alright,

Ro: now I’m just gonna hold it here, and
don’t cut off my fingers!

CS: I’m gonna try not to! Ro: And then you’re
just gonna cut all the way around.

CS: Ohhhh boy! Ro: Nice, uh-oh we got… There
we go. CS: I’m back on track, I think.

Ro: Doin’ great! Ohhhhh! CS: Oh, there we
go! I think I did it! Ro: Made it! OK.
CS: I hope so.

Ro: OK, now you’re just gonna take off the
excess dough.

CS: Beautiful! Ro: Look how pretty! CS: I
did it! Ro: You did it, very good!

Ro: And then, what I did is I cut out little
1 inch square design.

Ro: And you can make it look like whatever
you like, but I will put a template of this
Ro: down in the links, down below.

Ro: I will scan it, so if you guys want to
use these you can.

Ro: And then, ready for this? Trace the outline
of the shape, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

CS: See you have a way better method of doing
it with the…

Ro: Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo! CS: Yeah. Ro: The
jiggle? CS: Yeah!
Ro: Kinda… CS: The jiggle method.

Ro: And, you’re gonna very carefully take
out the middle,

Ro: because we want the outer… Shape. CS:
OK.

Ro: Take a little toothpick. CS: OK. Ro: And we’re
just gonna gently fling up the middle.

CS: OK, so it doesn’t matter if we mess
up the inside part? Ro: Yeah.

CS: OK, so now we’re gonna cut out 1 inch
squares from our leftover pie crust.

Ro: Mmmhmm. CS: So I guess I’m gonna place
it down and cut right around it.

Ro: Yeah, just trace it out. And you can make
as many of these as you’d like,
Ro: I’m just gonna put a few on the top.

Ro: We just took the pie out, it’s really
hot, there’s 10 minutes left to bake.

Ro: But we’re gonna take this dough, and
it’s OK if it breaks in half,

Ro: and you might actually just want to cut
it, right here, that’s fine!

CS: And now I do this with my big mitts? No?
OK. Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Bloop! Bloop!

Ro: Now you’re gonna pop this back in the
oven for 10 minutes, and let it bake
Ro: until this top crust is golden brown.
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here is our Pixelated Pumpkin Pie from
Minecraft!

Ro: I hope you guys liked it and I hope you like
the recipe!

Ro: And a big thank you to CaptainSparklez
for helping me bake today!

CS: Thanks for having me, I think it turned
out pretty well!

Ro: Mmmhmm! And I will be putting all of his
links down below so go check him out.
Ro: And, Jordan has a new game coming out.

CS: Yeah, it’s called Fortress Fallout,
it’s a 1 on 1 competitive strategy game

CS: on iOS and Android, so if you’re interested
I think that’s linked below as well.

Ro: Yep, I’ll put it down there so you can
go check it out.

Ro: And, if you guys bake this pumpkin pie,
please send us pictures,

Ro: I love seeing your baking creations. You
can send them to me on Twitter, Facebook,

Ro: Tumblr, Instagram, and you can tweet ‘em
to the both of us, because we want
Ro: to see these things!
CS: And also, like, show, show you opening the can!

Ro: Mmmhmm! CS: Because that’s an important
part of the process!

Ro: I think that’s the best part of this
process!

Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, if you
have any other ideas for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please leave me a comment
down below and let me know what you
Ro: would like to see me bake next!

Ro: Alright, thanks again, bye-bye! CS: See
ya!

CS: Alright Ro, so that was a pretty good
Pumpkin Pie recipe. Ro: Oh thank you!

CS: Tasted, tasted pretty nice, but uh, I’ve
actually got an alternative for you.

CS: We can make a pumpkin pie using the, uh,
traditional Minecraft method.
Ro: Oooh I’m excited, OK what do you do?

CS: So, yeah, you’ll just need an egg, bowl
of sugar, and just a full on pumpkin.
CS: And I brought along my own crafting table.
Ro: That’s this? OK.

CS: So we can, yeah, just toss them on in
here, and…
Ro: OH! CS: And there we go! Pumpkin Pie!

Ro: Oh my gosh! This is so cool! This was
so much easier. CS: Yeah.

Ro: We should have just done it the Minecraft
way!
